intro: Epipactis monticola, commonly known as the mountain helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a distinctive lip. Epipactis monticola is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
